result.execSummary:
The defendant Lachelle Renee Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child (Consequence is Great Bodily Harm), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(c).
  • Neglecting a Child (Consequence is Great Bodily Harm), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(c).
  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (1st w/Pass.), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: AS TO BOTH COUNTS: DNA sample; pay surcharge. Due to financial hardship, Court waived all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges. Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
- Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
- Successfully complete a parenting class.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- No driving without a valid drivers license.
- Children must be restrained in safety seats in the car.
- Pay all supervision fees as determined by the DOC's.
- Obtain/maintain employment.

timeConds.notes: STAYED; pending a review to be set by the Agent

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lachelle Renee Smith in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 3:  Defendant sentenced to serve 12 months in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  
.
AS TO COUNT 3:  Defendant sentenced to serve 12 months consecutive in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review to be set by the agent.
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete a parenting class.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No driving without a valid drivers license.
-Children must be restrained in safety seats in the car.
-DNA sample; pay the surcharge.
-Due to financial hardship, Court waived all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
.
AS TO COUNT 7:  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 4 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served.  Huber privileges for child care and treatment pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply.  Defendant to report 11/06/15; failure to report will result in straight time.
-Pay a fine of $350.00 by the end of probation
-Drivers License suspended for 18 months.
-AODA Assessment.

Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.

Defendant Lachelle Renee Smith in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija and Jamie Cimpl-Wiemer.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNTS 1,2,5 AND 6:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charges dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNTS 3,4,AND 7:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.

Case set for plea and sentencing.  Defense is not ready to proceed as the defendant has had medical issues and has been in the hosptial.  Court granted the request to adjourn.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.

Defendant Lachelle Renee Smith in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija and Jamie Cimpl-Wiemer.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gabriela A Leija and Jamie Cimpl-Wiemer in court.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Case set for plea hearing.  Counsel informed the Court the defendant is in the hospital.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Court ordered case adjourned for calendar call and plea hearing on 7/17/15 at 1:30 in Branch 40.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Calendar call scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lachelle Renee Smith in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for final pretrial conference.  Defendant is going to be entering a plea on this matter but would like another date.  Court granted motion to vacate the 6/15/15 jury trial.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lachelle Renee Smith in court with attorneys Jamie Cimpl-Wiemer and Gabriela A. Leija.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Scheduling Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lachelle Renee Smith in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer and Gabriella Leija.  Molly Schmidt for Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
JUDGE WAGNER FOR JUDGE DALLET.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant to report for booking and release no later than 3:00 p.m. on 03-05-2015

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 03-20-2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Lachelle Renee Smith
Current: 5071 North 23rd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 03-04-2015)
Prior: 2509 W Glendale Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53209

As an additional condition of bail:
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No drugs without a valid prescription

Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Lachelle Renee Smith in court with attorney Gabriela A. Leija.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-043

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

As to Count 7:
Defendant entered a plea of Not Guilty.

Court orders case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 40.
